instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3209: What is 820-3209? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP1V05_S0:
What is PP1V05_S0? The PP1V05_S0 power rail is for various components on the logic board that require a 1.05V supply voltage in the S0 (on) state. This voltage rail is likely to be used by the CPU (for VCCIO), PCH (Platform Controller Hub).

.
definitions.SSD_RESET_L: What is SSD_RESET_L? SSD_RESET_L is a signal that puts the SSD in reset mode when it is low. This means the SSD will not be accessible when this signal is asserted.  _L means whatever before the _L in the signal name is asserted when it is low voltage, such as 0.0v to 0.5v..
definitions.3V3_S0: What is 3V3_S0? Abbreviation for PP3V3_S0, a 3.3v power rail present when the machine is in an S0 working state.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not recognize ssd
threads.message: Suddenly not recognize ssd, very small water damage, <SIGNAL>PP1V05_S0</SIGNAL> is short, but i dont find from were..i was look at all that line but dont see any suspicious things.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not recognize ssd
threads.message:
Is not short, if machine works.
PCH power line has very low resistance to ground as normal, on this board.

Check first L4500 and <RESISTOR>R4520</RESISTOR>.
Post <SIGNAL>SSD_RESET_L</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>SSD_CLKREQ_L</SIGNAL>; with SSD connected, of course.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not recognize ssd
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not recognize ssd
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not recognize ssd
threads.message:
"<SIGNAL>SSD_CLKREQ_L</SIGNAL>  3.3V"
Bad value!
Check trace and connection for pin 19/J4501.
Also try another SSD.
Clock request line must be pulled down inside SSD.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not recognize ssd
threads.message:
pin 19 trace is o.k 
i was already try another ssd.
<RESISTOR>R1834</RESISTOR> ( <SIGNAL>SSD_CLKREQ_L</SIGNAL>) (<SIGNAL>3V3_S0</SIGNAL>) look o.k

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not recognize ssd
threads.message: at disk utility the ssd is recognized

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not recognize ssd
threads.message:
Then could be an APFS issue.
Take an empty SSD and do fresh install of HS, or Mojave.
